page.title: 18VILLAGE LIFE
page.content: For employment the majority of working people have to travel out of the vill- ages. Farmwork now occupies few people -1 man per 200 acres.A few, mostly women, work in gangs which visit farms to work in the fields as needed. There is employment at Raynham R.A.F.,some self employment, unemployment, & many go to the towns or further & return home only at weekends. Nearly all families own at least 1 car.Public transport is limited. There is a twice daily National Bus service to London but there are local buses to King's Lynn & Fakenham only on market days. On the recreation field there is a cricket pitch which is used by various organisations but there is no actual village team. A well-supported village bowls team plays there. Some villagers belong to a local Citizens Band (C.B.) Radio club.Much television is watched.
